name: Street Totochèr
description:
100% Pei video game
Street Totocher aims to showcase Reunion's culture and rich cultural diversity through a fighting video game.
Totochers include "Kaniar Lakour", "Ton Matante", "Sinoi", "Malbaraise" and "Ton Monmon".

The game also has a humorous dimension, highlighting clichés.
These clichés are not negative, "but rather something that belongs to us and is part of our history".
Everyone will be able to identify with the game, and above all laugh about it with family and friends.

The highlight of the game is the emphasis on the Kréol language.
The characters will make jokes and provocations in Réunion's characteristic language. Certain characters will have their signature lines, such as Yab's "Ki sa la vole mon can-nard", or "Koifé la" for Kaniar Lakour.

Updates to the game will be regular and free of charge (new characters, new locations and new game modes).
